ui

Class GameRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.GameUI
      • ui.GameMain
        • ui.GameRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener

    public class GameRenderer
extends GameMain
implements javax.media.opengl.GLEventListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    Class that performs game render and window management tasks, i.e., implements JOGL and frame/window methods. The main class of the game engine.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ui.GameUI

        GameUI.State

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ui.GameMain

        beginTime, CANVAS_HEIGHT, CANVAS_WIDTH, d, dt, dx, dy, endTime, force, fs, GAME_UPDATE_PERIOD, GAME_UPDATE_RATE, gameName, h, lastTimeStamp, mouseKeyBoardHandler, n, source, u, updateCount, v, windowActive

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameRenderer(java.lang.String pId, java.lang.String aiLogic, java.lang.String gridConfig)
      Constructor, receives a player unique id, mays set up (if a valid AI is chosen) the AI to use, and configures a communication node with a personalized configuration (if provided a valid path to a configuration file).

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameRenderer

        public GameRenderer(java.lang.String pId,
            java.lang.String aiLogic,
            java.lang.String gridConfig)
        Constructor, receives a player unique id, mays set up (if a valid AI is chosen) the AI to use, and configures a communication node with a personalized configuration (if provided a valid path to a configuration file).
        Parameters:
        pId - player unique id.
        aiLogic - the AI logic to use.
        gridConfig - a valid path to a configuration file.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method. Calls the class constructor and then starts the game loop, i.e., a thread.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line or shell arguments
